chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R. Kleutsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution shall be determined within 30 days.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall have no contact with E.A.B.-dob:12-4-97 and no contact with minors under the age of 18, except for employment purposes and approval by the probation agent.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent.
  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence to be served within 60 days at the discretion of the probation agent.  Jail sentence may be served by electronic monitoring.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Court calls the case.  Defendant Joseph R. Kleutsch in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties received the PSI. Victim notification has been complied with.  Court reviewed Victim impact statements. Arguments on sentencing. Defendant makes statement.  Courts withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for four years with the following conditions: court costs; restitution to be determined within 30 days; DNA sample and surcharge; 1 year county jail with Huber; Counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent; comply with sex offender registry; no contact with E.A.B-dob: 12-4-97 and no contact with minors under the age of 18, exception of employment purposes and with approval by probation agent.  Atty Cveykus requests that jail sentence may be served by electronic monitoring.  Court grants request. -ba
Sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Joseph R. Kleutsch in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Attorney Tlusty would like to move the charge to 3rd Degree sexual assault - 940.225(3) - Class G Felony.   Attorney Tlusty goes over the penalties.    Court amends the charge to 3rd degree sexual assault - 940.225(3) - Class G Felony.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.   Court orders a presentence.  Sentencing date to be schedule.  Bond continued.
